result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Robert Gutting was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond of $500 was applied to court obligations.

Provide DNA sample.
Cooperate with the Department of Corrections.
Complete any treatment and programs as deemed appropriate by Agent.
Pay Supervision fees.
Follow all rules impsed by Agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant may serve in another County as long as it is at no cost to Pierce County and the Sheriff's agree. Rules must be the same as PC Jail's.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Robert Gutting

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on December 18, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: to Defendant's employer terminating wage assignment.
TOTAL AMOUNT OWED: $500.00
of Attorney Fees with itemized billing attached.
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Joshua Robert Gutting in Court with Attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  ADA William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 2:37 p.m.  Court notes receipt of PSI.  Atty. Helgeson notes factual errors on pages five and nine.  ADA Thorie notes concerns regarding prior convictions and makes recommendations; requests sentence withheld and 3 years Probation w/3-6 months in PCJ.  Atty. Helgeson requests Court adopt PSI recommendations; makes statement.  Requests time to report and work release if Court imposes Jail.  Defendant declines statement.  Court sentences Defendant, W/H.  Court orders Two years Probation.  Conditions include court costs of $515.  To provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Cooperate with the Department of Corrections and complete any treatment and programs as deemed appropriate by Agent.  Pay Supervision fees.  Follow all rules as set forth by the DOC.  Court orders Three months in Pierce County Jail.  Work release allowed.  To commence Jail within 60 days, no later than April 2, 2016, at 7:00 p.m.  Atty. Helegson questions serving in another County.  Court states Defendant may serve in another County as long as it is at no cost to Pierce County and Sheriff's agree.  Rules must be the same as PC Jail.  Court advises of appeal rights.  Advising of loss of right to vote and no possession of firearms.  Court will allow 30 days to submit restitution request.  Atty. Helgeson may request hearing.
Copies were provided to DA's office and Atty Helgeson

9:58 a.m.  Defendant Joshua Robert Gutting in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 14CT61, 15CF63 and 15CF154.  Froelich - PSI on 15CF154, 15CF63 - Ct 1, dismiss but read in for restitution, Ct. 2 - dismiss.  15CF57 dismissed.  14CT61 - dismissed.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 in 15CF154.      Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1 in 15CF154.  Court dismisses 15CF63, Ct. 2, dismisses, Ct 1 shall be read in for restitution purposes but dismissed.  14CT61 shall be dismissed.  15CF57 dismissed.  Appeal rights given.  Bond to continue.  Bond conditions reviewed with defendant.
Sentencing hearing at 02-02-2016 03:00 pm
Plea hearing at 11-23-2015 09:30 am.
State's
Pre-trial conference at 09-21-2015 08:45 am.
Def pleas not guilty. Court entered. Bond to remain and goes over conditions with Def.

9:33 Defendant Joshua Robert Gutting in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CT61, 15CF57 and 15CF63 followed along.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant. Def waives his right to have his preliminary hearing.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing. Finds the Def probably commited a felony and binds the Def over for trial.   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant. Court reads charges and maximum penalties. Def waives further reading.

Phil Helgeson is a court appointed attorney for this case and 15CF154. However there is not a wage assignment filled out on 15CF154. When attorney fees for this case are paid in full, checks needs to be receipted to 15CF154.

15R 003169
Bail/Bond envelope, Notice Regarding Bond Posting and Booking Sheet
Court appoints Atty Helgeson since Atty Helgeson was appointed on 14CF46
Preliminary hearing at 08-31-2015 09:30 am

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Court goes over bond conditions with Def.

4:56 Defendant Joshua Robert Gutting in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Joshua Robert Gutting in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reads charges and maximum penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Court does appoint Helgeson to represent Def in this matter as court appointed counsel.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: $1000 cash bond. Helgeson requests signature bond. Court addresses representation for Def on court trial in August. Helgeson will to meet with him. Court quashes warrant on 14CF146.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:30 am.
